title.narrative: Conserving Greater Virunga Project

description.narrative: Improving transboundary collaboration, supporting effective management, providing relevant accessible information, and promoting inclusive development

Overall: Sustainable conservation of the Greater Virunga Landscape, through transboundary collaboration between the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda and Uganda 1.Coordinate and promote conservation of biodiversity within the GVL 2.Promote collaboration and coordination of Natural resource based socio-economic development in the GVL 3.Create conditions for sustainable transboundary collaboration on conservation and tourism

The management of protected areas listed in appendix 1 of GVTC treaty The communities in the Greater Virunga landscape The GVTC conservation partner organisations operating in Greater Virunga Landscape

recipient-country.narrative: CGV was a transboundary project implemented under GVTC and Rwanda was one of the beneficiary Countries. The others are DRC and Uganda.

title.narrative: Percentage of change in reduction of incidences of poaching and trafficking (wildlife crime) realized through transboundary collaboration and coordination efforts. 63% reduction (1776 cases recorded in 2021-No data for PNVi).

description.narrative: 5. Treaty ratified. Treaty ratification critical steps in each partner state identified. Consultations done with Ministers in All PS. Uganda drafted a paper for the cabinet.

title.narrative: Percentage of change in reduction of incidences of poaching and trafficking (wildlife crime) realized through transboundary collaboration and coordination efforts.

Governance structures functional as scheduled in treaty. Number of meetings of each governance structure attended per annum as a fraction of the statutory meetings (multiplied by 100 to express as a percentage). In 2021, 100% RTC and 0% for Board and Council of Ministers were held.

description.narrative: Number of transboundary wildlife conservation recommendations submitted to PAAs/ Partner states for action. Number of incidences negatively affecting protection and Management of GVL. Count of recommendations None because no Board sitting

title.narrative: Governance structures functional as scheduled in treaty
Trends in area under conservation. % change from one period to the next. No data and no reduction in 2021.

description.narrative: Percentage of cases of identified conflicts that have been effectively either transformed or resolved through transboundary coordination dialogues or other collaborative mechanisms. Number of conflicts solved/transformed over the number of conflicts identified through transboundary dialogues multiplied by100. 3 Conflicts resolved: (conflict regarding unclear international boundary (Bwindi-Sarambwe) resolved in 2019; Encroachment into MGNP side about (2 metres) by Virunga NP counterparts for erection of an electric fence and HWC at Bugeshi between PNVi and Rwanda community).

Trends in area under conservation.

Trends of status of key species on IUCN red list ( gorilla, elephant and Hippo)%tage change from one period to the next . Calculate %age (current year amount of each spp on the redlist) divided by Baseline line year 2019 1064 Mt gorillas and year 2000 was 6000 in QENP.No Animal Survey baseline in VNP because of insecurity.

Benefit sharing trends for the transboundary PAs;
Cross border tourism information uploaded on GVTC website for sharing and Advocacy engagement/dialogues held,
Number of PA Management recommendations agreed on any contagious Pas
Number of funding partners attracted for conservation of GVL
Number of joint GVL branding tourism promotion activities done with National agencies and tourist trends disaggregated by various tourism products
Number of meetings, dialogues aimed at advocating or mitigating oil and gas exploration in GVL

Measurable indicator: number of non-primate tourism products developed in transboundary PAs and Tourist trends disaggregated by various tourism products. Description and unit of measurement and disaggregation: no of tourists received per product from each pa over a period of time presented as either a bar graph or line graph As a result, no new non-primate products and non-primate tourism products were birding, nature walk and Hiking.
Number of non-primate tourism products developed in transboundary PAs and Tourist trends disaggregated by various tourism products.
Number of partners collaborating with GVTC on transboundary wildlife conservation and tourism development
Number of recommendations agreed and implemented by the PAAs and partners
Number of recommendations made through RTCs that are adopted by the PAAs
Number of recommendations made through RTCs that are adopted by the PAAs
Number of recommendations made through RTCs that are adopted
Number of regional and international collaborative engagements
Number of security dialogue meetings, recommendations made and presented to relevant stakeholders for action
Number of steps supported towards ratification of the treaty in each of the partner states;
Number of transboundary wildlife conservation legislative recommendations agreed by PAAs

Measurable indicator: Number of transboundary wildlife conservation recommendations submitted to PAAs/ Partner states for action and number of incidences negatively affecting protection and Management of GVL. Description: Count of recommendations and Count of incidences. Result: There was no Board sitting and therefore no recommendations were considered
Number of transboundary wildlife conservation recommendations submitted to PAAs/ Partner states for action and number of incidences negatively affecting protection and Management of GVL
Number of visitors to the GVTC website requesting for data and or downloading it

Measurable indicator: Number of wildlife crime cases reported / handled by agencies in TB wildlife crime prevention; and Number of coordinated patrols conducted in transboundary wildlife crime hotspot areas. Description and unit of measurement and disaggregation: Count of wildlife crime cases handled and Count of coordinated patrols. As a result, due to Covid-19, coordinated patrols were not conducted in transboundary wildlife crime crime hotspot areas.
Number of wildlife crime cases reported / handled by agencies in TB wildlife crime prevention

Percentage of cases of identified conflicts that have been effectively either transformed or resolved through transboundary coordination dialogues or other collaborative mechanisms. Number of conflicts solved/transformed over the number of conflicts identified through transboundary dialogues multiplied by100. 3 Conflicts resolved: (conflict regarding unclear international boundary (Bwindi-Sarambwe) resolved in 2019; Encroachment into MGNP side about (2 metres) by Virunga NP counterparts for erection of an electric fence and HWC at Bugeshi between PNVi and Rwanda community).
Percentage of cases of identified conflicts that have been effectively either transformed or resolved through transboundary coordination dialogues or other collaborative mechanisms.

Measurable indicator: Production of Annual Conservation Status Report, Number of transboundary information/data uploaded on GVTC website, and Trends of requests to downloading data from GVTC website Description and unit of measurement and disaggregation: Report produced per year, Count of times data is uploaded on website, and Analysis of website data downloads Result: zero (0).
Production of Annual Conservation Status Report
Treaty ratified. Treaty ratification critical steps in each partner state identified. Consultations done with Ministers in All PS. Uganda drafted a paper for the cabinet.
